1.heading: Sensibility
1.raw:
When we were looking at the abstract process, we saw that the 42 has resources of energy. What we see in the 9th hexagram is that we have a resource for concentration, what we call attention. The attention is
there. We don't know out of this what the attention span is. Just like the 42 has to go to the 29 to find its commitment, the 9 has to go to the 5 to find out what its pattern must be. To be focused and concentrated
is never enough. This is the beginning of a process. It is a process that says, in the first line, Sensibility. A balanced and responsible approach to problem solving. Pluto exalted. The ability to avoid frustration
through the creation of new forms. The reality is that the focus here is not simply on the given, which is, "I have the capacity for attention". What is more important is how do I maintain that capacity for
attention?

Mars in detriment. After a hasty and frustrating search, the urge to kick in the door when the key is in your pocket. This is not recognizing what the pattern is. This is all about simply having this energy for
concentration but not knowing where to concentrate, on what to concentrate. You think that if you concentrate on remembering where the keys are, somehow that will work. When it doesn't, when you
can't go in there and find them, you get very frustrated and kick in the door.

In the white book we have: The power in focusing to create new forms; or The power to generate that will lose its focus. Please understand this: this is about attention. % all know from children that to maintain
their attention, either you fix their pattern or you cannot hold their attention. Otherwise, they will just move from this thing to the next because they do not have an extended attention span. That is why we
need, in the logical process, to have a codified system that develops our logic. Vita have to learn the patterns of logic. This is very important for us because if we don't have the pattern, we can have the
energy for the logical process but not know what to do with it. These people become deeply restless. They can focus their attention but on what? and how? and when? This is what they don't know.

Page 1

By the way, Pluto is coming in the 9th gate by the end of 1997. Pluto will transit this gate for three years.
When it says, A balanced and responsible approach to problem solving, it is not saying 'a balanced and responsible approach to solving problems.' It is the process that gets to eventually solving a problem.

2.heading: Misery loves company
2.raw:
What happens when you get to the second line, Misery loves company, the projection that is coming out of the second line is: "I can solve the problem because I can focus." This is not how the problem is
solved. It is one necessary aspect in order to solve a problem eventually, but this is the illusion that is caught up in the projection. So many students of mine over the years, the typical 9.2 students, study and
focus all the time and they don't actually learn anything. They study books all day and study the same thing over and over again and nothing really comes out of that. That is the potential in this. To solve the
problem is not the same as problem solving. This is a process that this line projects out.

Misery loves company. Remember, we are in the collective here, so it is social. Collaboration with others to temper frustration. They are projecting out: "I can solve the problem. I can concentrate." With that,
they get the energy around them that others say, "Okay, we will join in that process of concentration."
Remember that the logic process is a collective process, like a laboratory full of scientists all working on the same thing in order to solve the problem. Science generally is a collective process. Logic works in the
collective field.

Jupiter in detriment. The overwhelming need for expansion can lead to errors in judgment, missed opportunities and depression. The child that says, "But I study, why didn't I pass? I stared at it all day. It
got my full attention. I was focused on it." That is the whole thing about the second line: what is projected out does not necessarily have the depth behind it. It is not introspective. It is just projecting out, "I can
solve the problems because I can focus." That is not solving the problem. That's the way to solving a problem.

3.heading: The Straw that breaks the camels back
3.raw:
This third line is an archetype like the 42.3. It is The overlooked minor element that always predetermines failure. Whenever you see the word failure or mistake in a third line, it is okay because this is exactly
where it is supposed to be. It does not mean that there is anything terrible about that at all. It just means that for certain in this third line, this process of bonds made and broken, of trial and error, of learning
from mistakes, is going to be accentuated.

Earth exalted. The use of force to temporarily overcome impediments. In other words, the moment that something is not working in the concentration, to put even more concentration on it.

On the other side: Persistent force that saps vitality and turns molehills into mountains. These people will always miss something. There is always a moment in which their concentration breaks. There is a
moment that the concentration just simply is not there and, in that moment, you can take the wrong turn and go for a long detour. In that moment, you can just miss, literally, what is there. What is missed can
become an enormous thing.

It is the logic process that makes the word 'mistake' ugly. The abstract people do not care about mistakes.
Crisis is part of their way of life. But logical people get very upset with mistakes. "One and one is not two but three." "No, two." It is this whole process of, "That is a mistake; you have to correct that." It has to be
right because the logic process has to be consistently provable for the collective. Making a mistake in the logic process can create a lot of deep anxiety in logical people because the very nature of logic is to

Page 2

eliminate the mistakes so that we can know for certain. "What is this formula: E=MC2? Let's make it certain. We'd better check that out. Otherwise, we scratch this thing away because we are not going to put
that into the world and predict naturally into the future with that, unless we can be certain that this foundation is correct."

What happens here in the third line is the miracle of what logic always needs. Logic always needs the illogic of a mistake because out of this can come so many wonders. That moment where there is
something that is missed, that moment that everything breaks down and is a failure, that moment can turn into an enormous success. The classic example is of the scientist who, in the moment of losing their
concentration, allows something to get too hot and explode. Out of that explosion comes something wonderful and, "Wow, that is amazing. How did that happen?" It is illogical and that makes them very
uncomfortable.

In the white book: The loss of power through the failure to focus. It is gone. You lose it in that moment.
The power is gone and you can't focus and then something will be missed because the concentration was not there.

On the other side of this: The power to turn a focus into an obsession. Mature 9.3 people have learned a lot, like so many people that carry the third line themes in their life. They get to learn a lot because they
make what other people consider a lot of mistakes. Out of all their mistakes they learn many things that others don't get to learn.

4.heading: Dedication
4.raw:
We come to our line of externalization, our line of being fixed. These people are fixed on the resonance of the first line. They are fixed on problem solving, on providing their energy for the logical process. This
energy is basically the energy to be able to lead and to guide others through the experimentation with the logical process. This will eventually go all the way up to the leadership channel, the channel of being an
alpha. So, it is about the process of gathering energy in order to guide humanity through understanding.

This line is called Dedication. Regardless of the pressures or stress, the disciplined attention to detail.
These people are fixed on being focused. These are people that must concentrate.

Moon exalted. Right action that leads inevitably to actualization. Right action being the action to concentrate. This is what these people are there for: to live out clearly this fixed one way. Concentration
is their way. Mars in detriment. The persistent urge to want to skip essential steps. In other words, I have concentrated enough. Now I want to act. This is not an awareness that can decide that.

You have two sides of this in the white book: The power to act on the potential of the focus; or The drive for action that ignores the details. This need to generate: keep in mind that the logic process is under so
much stress because it does not have easy access to energy. The people who carry the logical energy gates feel this enormous pressure on them to release their energy because the rest of the logical process wants it
so that they can do their experiments and can actually lead and guide. There is a great deal of stress in that sense on the concentrating field from others.

Remember, again: collective and social in this context. The key in that is that they have this power and they are externalizing this power. These are the people that help other people concentrate. If you have five
kids studying together and one of them has the 9.4, the moment that one of them says, "Let's take a break and listen to some music," it will be the 9.4 that is saying, "No, we are here to focus and concentrate.
We'd better get this done." Logic is collective. They have that power to keep everybody focused on that logical process.

5.heading: Faith
5.raw:
This fifth line is so perverse. It is one of the most perverse lines in all of the I'Ching. It is very bizarre. We know that the fifth line is a line of universalization and we know that the fifth line, in the resonance to the
second line, rather than projecting outwards is being projected upon. Look at the keynote of this line. It says, Faith. Faith has nothing to do with the logic process. This is a projection from the outside onto
people who obviously have a concentrative skill. The projection from the outside is, "We have faith in them because they are concentrating. We have faith that the doctors will find a cure to... because they are
concentrating on..." But, like the student that does not learn anything, they may not figure it out either.
Nonetheless, this brings an element of the belief system into the logical process. It is, in that sense, that I call it perverse because this is very strange.

As an overview: The trust that detailed adherence will lead to fulfillment. In other words, if you really concentrate, you will really get it. Well, maybe. This is after all the projection coming from the outside.
The people who get that projection put on them are under all kinds of pressure to be able to fulfill that.
Jupiter exalted. Loyalty to the letter of the law. That is, "You concentrate. You do not take off from that."

Then this wonderful line in the black book: Earth in detriment. Like the mystery of God, doubt engendered through the perceived illogic of a process. "How can I have faith that I will find the solution
when all I know to do is how to concentrate? There is something bizarre in all these people putting their faith and trust in me; just because I can stare all day does not mean that I will come up with a viable
solution." In that, it brings an energy of doubt: "Is this all I have to do? Just concentrate?" Of course, it isn't.

The power to focus and bring value to concentration; or Where the lack of power to concentrate leads to doubt. This strange abstract concept stuck in the middle of how we universalize the energy to be
concentrated. If you have two kids and one of them studies and the other one never studies, and you ask their parents which one do they think is going to pass and do well, the parent that has the child that
studies says, "I have faith that they will do all right. They are doing their work." The other parent says, "No, I do not have any faith because they are not concentrating." That does not mean that the one who
does not concentrate fails and the concentrated one succeeds. This is the whole irony of this and this is why it brings doubt. It brings doubt because this is only an aspect in a very complex collective process of
establishing logic in the world.

6.heading: Gratitude
6.raw:
The sixth line is a very beautiful line because it carries with it a quality that you do not often see which is the quality of joy. There is joy that is clearly evident in the 9th and in the fifth hexagram as well. This is:
The joy which comes with accepting small rewards for small victories. The real beauty of concentration is that it is there to provide power to solve something, to bring something ultimately into a fact. Each step
along the way is really a value. As long as one is clear about what one is focused on, there can be enormous joy in that process, but we know the limitation of the sixth line, which is: there must be more to
all of this.

The greatest problem that sixth line logical people here have is that they are trying to look at the final solution, where everything has been worked out and the formulas have been established so they can say,
"I will work for that. I will concentrate on that and get my joy out of getting there." But you cannot know in the logical process that you actually will get there. This line in the black book comes from an old
Chinese saying, A journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step.' If you take the first step in agony, in anticipation of the rest of that journey, if you think that you will only take that first step, or that

Page 4

you cannot go to the end of that journey, you will never start on that road. This is the essence for the logical process.

For the sixth line here, it is not about whether I can get to that final step or not; it is whether or not I can find joy in each step. They will not take that step and they will not concentrate unless each step is a joy.
This is what it is all about for them. They have to have joy in this focus and concentration in their life. It has to make them feel good, not the solution but the process. After all, this is what it is all about. This is
all about providing essential energy for a logical process and not for the solution.

Pluto in detriment, No single step is of value until the journey is over. If there is no joy in each step, they will not get into it. They just won't and they learn that very quickly and then they start pulling back and
they do not give their energy for the logical process.

In the white book: Moon exalted. The power to enjoy the concentrating process. The Moon is bringing that quality out. The moment you see the Moon connected to a line, you know that this line is going to
have a cycle. It is rising from a low to a peak and back to a low in its cycle and you know that you will go through all of these aspects. Somebody who has the Moon here exalted, at the beginning of their lunar
cycle, that can be like the no-moon phase. They don't really enjoy it and the next day they enjoy it a little bit more and so on, until they reach a peak and then they start sliding down the other end. Logic is about
repetition and it can get boring.

The other side is: The energy for expression that cannot find joy in the process until it is complete. In the logic process, here is the ultimate joke: it is never complete. There will be people who will check out the
Human Design System for as long as there are people who check out anything logically, whether or not generation after generation says that logic works. That is my old joke: when I was a student studying
science, I had to do all these old formulas. Those formulas have been checked for hundreds of years, over and over again. The joke is, whenever I read in my favorite scientific journals that some old formula that
everybody thought was cast in concrete and somebody found a mistake. The other day, they just discovered that they think that light actually has two different speeds, depending on where you are
standing. According to Einstein, there is only one speed of light. Formulas never get trusted and, of course, that is the joke here. This is very deeply depressing.

If you really think that the only way that you can commit yourself to a logical process is if you know that it will bring about the correct answer, you never know. You cannot know and when you have it in your
hand. You still can't let go off the fact that it is always going to be open to what is natural in the logic process: criticism, the need to correct, the need to make sure that it is perfect, the need to lead with it. All
this is necessary for working in the logic process. The faith of the fifth line comes in here. You have to trust every single step because it is never complete. It is part of that illogical process that lies here at the
beginning of this. There is no guarantee of logic. There is nothing but this quality of faith which logical people, at their core, do not want to have to deal with. It is okay for a believer to say, "I believe that we
will have a cure for AIDS." That is very nice, but that is not the same as a logical person's attitude towards the very same phenomenon because the logical person says that it is possible that a cure for AIDS
can be found. But we have to do our research and we have to check it out and do our experiments. The perfect joke is: when you get to the sixth line here, the next hexagram is the fifth hexagram, first line, and
that is exactly where the 9 goes in the circuitry.

can be found. But we have to do our research and we have to check it out and do our experiments. The perfect joke is: when you get to the sixth line here, the next hexagram is the fifth hexagram, first line, and
that is exactly where the 9 goes in the circuitry.

HEXAGRAM 9 THE TAMING POWER OF THE SMALL

We move to the logic process and take a look at rituals and patterns. Two of the 64 hexagrams use the word 'taming' and there are two that use the word 'small'. The small has to do with the nature of detail.
The ability to tame is the ability to master the nature of the detail. The 9th gate is the gate of the mastery of the energy for detail. This is the format energy of the logical process. One of the most difficult things
in the nature of what it is to be human, with the configuration that we have, is to establish logic in the world. How difficult it is to establish understanding in the world because understanding does not have the
same access to energy as other processes. It does not have the same easy access to energy as the abstract, the experiential process has. In order for us to establish logic and understanding in the world, it is quite an
ordeal to find the energy.

With the 9th and the fifth hexagrams, two gates of the sacral, we look at essential energy to manifest logic and understanding in the world so that we can be properly organized and, in being properly organized, we
can have a relative perspective into the future. Only three gates provide energy for logic, the 58, the 9 and the 52. They are a long way from having an opportunity to be able to manifest and most of the logic and
understanding that gets into the world is generated rather than manifested. Generated logic is quite different because it is logic that can only come out of response: out of response to a need for the logic.

Above the lines it says: Potential can be fulfilled through detailed attention to all pertinent aspects. Don't confuse this with a mental perspective. It is not mental. This is pure energy. This is the energy to fulfill
the potential through attention. This channel is all about being focused and concentrated. This is a deep concentrating and focusing field.

9.1 Sensibility

When we were looking at the abstract process, we saw that the 42 has resources of energy. What we see in the 9th hexagram is that we have a resource for concentration, what we call attention. The attention is
there. We don't know out of this what the attention span is. Just like the 42 has to go to the 29 to find its commitment, the 9 has to go to the 5 to find out what its pattern must be. To be focused and concentrated
is never enough. This is the beginning of a process. It is a process that says, in the first line, Sensibility. A balanced and responsible approach to problem solving. Pluto exalted. The ability to avoid frustration
through the creation of new forms. The reality is that the focus here is not simply on the given, which is, "I have the capacity for attention". What is more important is how do I maintain that capacity for
attention?

Mars in detriment. After a hasty and frustrating search, the urge to kick in the door when the key is in your pocket. This is not recognizing what the pattern is. This is all about simply having this energy for
concentration but not knowing where to concentrate, on what to concentrate. You think that if you concentrate on remembering where the keys are, somehow that will work. When it doesn't, when you
can't go in there and find them, you get very frustrated and kick in the door.

In the white book we have: The power in focusing to create new forms; or The power to generate that will lose its focus. Please understand this: this is about attention. % all know from children that to maintain
their attention, either you fix their pattern or you cannot hold their attention. Otherwise, they will just move from this thing to the next because they do not have an extended attention span. That is why we
need, in the logical process, to have a codified system that develops our logic. Vita have to learn the patterns of logic. This is very important for us because if we don't have the pattern, we can have the
energy for the logical process but not know what to do with it. These people become deeply restless. They can focus their attention but on what? and how? and when? This is what they don't know.

Page 1

By the way, Pluto is coming in the 9th gate by the end of 1997. Pluto will transit this gate for three years.
When it says, A balanced and responsible approach to problem solving, it is not saying 'a balanced and responsible approach to solving problems.' It is the process that gets to eventually solving a problem.

9.2 Misery loves company

What happens when you get to the second line, Misery loves company, the projection that is coming out of the second line is: "I can solve the problem because I can focus." This is not how the problem is
solved. It is one necessary aspect in order to solve a problem eventually, but this is the illusion that is caught up in the projection. So many students of mine over the years, the typical 9.2 students, study and
focus all the time and they don't actually learn anything. They study books all day and study the same thing over and over again and nothing really comes out of that. That is the potential in this. To solve the
problem is not the same as problem solving. This is a process that this line projects out.

Misery loves company. Remember, we are in the collective here, so it is social. Collaboration with others to temper frustration. They are projecting out: "I can solve the problem. I can concentrate." With that,
they get the energy around them that others say, "Okay, we will join in that process of concentration."
Remember that the logic process is a collective process, like a laboratory full of scientists all working on the same thing in order to solve the problem. Science generally is a collective process. Logic works in the
collective field.

Jupiter in detriment. The overwhelming need for expansion can lead to errors in judgment, missed opportunities and depression. The child that says, "But I study, why didn't I pass? I stared at it all day. It
got my full attention. I was focused on it." That is the whole thing about the second line: what is projected out does not necessarily have the depth behind it. It is not introspective. It is just projecting out, "I can
solve the problems because I can focus." That is not solving the problem. That's the way to solving a problem.

9.3 The Straw that breaks the camels back

This third line is an archetype like the 42.3. It is The overlooked minor element that always predetermines failure. Whenever you see the word failure or mistake in a third line, it is okay because this is exactly
where it is supposed to be. It does not mean that there is anything terrible about that at all. It just means that for certain in this third line, this process of bonds made and broken, of trial and error, of learning
from mistakes, is going to be accentuated.

Earth exalted. The use of force to temporarily overcome impediments. In other words, the moment that something is not working in the concentration, to put even more concentration on it.

On the other side: Persistent force that saps vitality and turns molehills into mountains. These people will always miss something. There is always a moment in which their concentration breaks. There is a
moment that the concentration just simply is not there and, in that moment, you can take the wrong turn and go for a long detour. In that moment, you can just miss, literally, what is there. What is missed can
become an enormous thing.

It is the logic process that makes the word 'mistake' ugly. The abstract people do not care about mistakes.
Crisis is part of their way of life. But logical people get very upset with mistakes. "One and one is not two but three." "No, two." It is this whole process of, "That is a mistake; you have to correct that." It has to be
right because the logic process has to be consistently provable for the collective. Making a mistake in the logic process can create a lot of deep anxiety in logical people because the very nature of logic is to

Page 2

eliminate the mistakes so that we can know for certain. "What is this formula: E=MC2? Let's make it certain. We'd better check that out. Otherwise, we scratch this thing away because we are not going to put
that into the world and predict naturally into the future with that, unless we can be certain that this foundation is correct."

What happens here in the third line is the miracle of what logic always needs. Logic always needs the illogic of a mistake because out of this can come so many wonders. That moment where there is
something that is missed, that moment that everything breaks down and is a failure, that moment can turn into an enormous success. The classic example is of the scientist who, in the moment of losing their
concentration, allows something to get too hot and explode. Out of that explosion comes something wonderful and, "Wow, that is amazing. How did that happen?" It is illogical and that makes them very
uncomfortable.

In the white book: The loss of power through the failure to focus. It is gone. You lose it in that moment.
The power is gone and you can't focus and then something will be missed because the concentration was not there.

On the other side of this: The power to turn a focus into an obsession. Mature 9.3 people have learned a lot, like so many people that carry the third line themes in their life. They get to learn a lot because they
make what other people consider a lot of mistakes. Out of all their mistakes they learn many things that others don't get to learn.

9.4 Dedication

We come to our line of externalization, our line of being fixed. These people are fixed on the resonance of the first line. They are fixed on problem solving, on providing their energy for the logical process. This
energy is basically the energy to be able to lead and to guide others through the experimentation with the logical process. This will eventually go all the way up to the leadership channel, the channel of being an
alpha. So, it is about the process of gathering energy in order to guide humanity through understanding.

This line is called Dedication. Regardless of the pressures or stress, the disciplined attention to detail.
These people are fixed on being focused. These are people that must concentrate.

Moon exalted. Right action that leads inevitably to actualization. Right action being the action to concentrate. This is what these people are there for: to live out clearly this fixed one way. Concentration
is their way. Mars in detriment. The persistent urge to want to skip essential steps. In other words, I have concentrated enough. Now I want to act. This is not an awareness that can decide that.

You have two sides of this in the white book: The power to act on the potential of the focus; or The drive for action that ignores the details. This need to generate: keep in mind that the logic process is under so
much stress because it does not have easy access to energy. The people who carry the logical energy gates feel this enormous pressure on them to release their energy because the rest of the logical process wants it
so that they can do their experiments and can actually lead and guide. There is a great deal of stress in that sense on the concentrating field from others.

Remember, again: collective and social in this context. The key in that is that they have this power and they are externalizing this power. These are the people that help other people concentrate. If you have five
kids studying together and one of them has the 9.4, the moment that one of them says, "Let's take a break and listen to some music," it will be the 9.4 that is saying, "No, we are here to focus and concentrate.
We'd better get this done." Logic is collective. They have that power to keep everybody focused on that logical process.

9.5 Faith

This fifth line is so perverse. It is one of the most perverse lines in all of the I'Ching. It is very bizarre. We know that the fifth line is a line of universalization and we know that the fifth line, in the resonance to the
second line, rather than projecting outwards is being projected upon. Look at the keynote of this line. It says, Faith. Faith has nothing to do with the logic process. This is a projection from the outside onto
people who obviously have a concentrative skill. The projection from the outside is, "We have faith in them because they are concentrating. We have faith that the doctors will find a cure to... because they are
concentrating on..." But, like the student that does not learn anything, they may not figure it out either.
Nonetheless, this brings an element of the belief system into the logical process. It is, in that sense, that I call it perverse because this is very strange.

As an overview: The trust that detailed adherence will lead to fulfillment. In other words, if you really concentrate, you will really get it. Well, maybe. This is after all the projection coming from the outside.
The people who get that projection put on them are under all kinds of pressure to be able to fulfill that.
Jupiter exalted. Loyalty to the letter of the law. That is, "You concentrate. You do not take off from that."

Then this wonderful line in the black book: Earth in detriment. Like the mystery of God, doubt engendered through the perceived illogic of a process. "How can I have faith that I will find the solution
when all I know to do is how to concentrate? There is something bizarre in all these people putting their faith and trust in me; just because I can stare all day does not mean that I will come up with a viable
solution." In that, it brings an energy of doubt: "Is this all I have to do? Just concentrate?" Of course, it isn't.

The power to focus and bring value to concentration; or Where the lack of power to concentrate leads to doubt. This strange abstract concept stuck in the middle of how we universalize the energy to be
concentrated. If you have two kids and one of them studies and the other one never studies, and you ask their parents which one do they think is going to pass and do well, the parent that has the child that
studies says, "I have faith that they will do all right. They are doing their work." The other parent says, "No, I do not have any faith because they are not concentrating." That does not mean that the one who
does not concentrate fails and the concentrated one succeeds. This is the whole irony of this and this is why it brings doubt. It brings doubt because this is only an aspect in a very complex collective process of
establishing logic in the world.

9.6 Gratitude

The sixth line is a very beautiful line because it carries with it a quality that you do not often see which is the quality of joy. There is joy that is clearly evident in the 9th and in the fifth hexagram as well. This is:
The joy which comes with accepting small rewards for small victories. The real beauty of concentration is that it is there to provide power to solve something, to bring something ultimately into a fact. Each step
along the way is really a value. As long as one is clear about what one is focused on, there can be enormous joy in that process, but we know the limitation of the sixth line, which is: there must be more to
all of this.

The greatest problem that sixth line logical people here have is that they are trying to look at the final solution, where everything has been worked out and the formulas have been established so they can say,
"I will work for that. I will concentrate on that and get my joy out of getting there." But you cannot know in the logical process that you actually will get there. This line in the black book comes from an old
Chinese saying, A journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step.' If you take the first step in agony, in anticipation of the rest of that journey, if you think that you will only take that first step, or that

Page 4

you cannot go to the end of that journey, you will never start on that road. This is the essence for the logical process.

For the sixth line here, it is not about whether I can get to that final step or not; it is whether or not I can find joy in each step. They will not take that step and they will not concentrate unless each step is a joy.
This is what it is all about for them. They have to have joy in this focus and concentration in their life. It has to make them feel good, not the solution but the process. After all, this is what it is all about. This is
all about providing essential energy for a logical process and not for the solution.

Pluto in detriment, No single step is of value until the journey is over. If there is no joy in each step, they will not get into it. They just won't and they learn that very quickly and then they start pulling back and
they do not give their energy for the logical process.

In the white book: Moon exalted. The power to enjoy the concentrating process. The Moon is bringing that quality out. The moment you see the Moon connected to a line, you know that this line is going to
have a cycle. It is rising from a low to a peak and back to a low in its cycle and you know that you will go through all of these aspects. Somebody who has the Moon here exalted, at the beginning of their lunar
cycle, that can be like the no-moon phase. They don't really enjoy it and the next day they enjoy it a little bit more and so on, until they reach a peak and then they start sliding down the other end. Logic is about
repetition and it can get boring.

The other side is: The energy for expression that cannot find joy in the process until it is complete. In the logic process, here is the ultimate joke: it is never complete. There will be people who will check out the
Human Design System for as long as there are people who check out anything logically, whether or not generation after generation says that logic works. That is my old joke: when I was a student studying
science, I had to do all these old formulas. Those formulas have been checked for hundreds of years, over and over again. The joke is, whenever I read in my favorite scientific journals that some old formula that
everybody thought was cast in concrete and somebody found a mistake. The other day, they just discovered that they think that light actually has two different speeds, depending on where you are
standing. According to Einstein, there is only one speed of light. Formulas never get trusted and, of course, that is the joke here. This is very deeply depressing.

If you really think that the only way that you can commit yourself to a logical process is if you know that it will bring about the correct answer, you never know. You cannot know and when you have it in your
hand. You still can't let go off the fact that it is always going to be open to what is natural in the logic process: criticism, the need to correct, the need to make sure that it is perfect, the need to lead with it. All
this is necessary for working in the logic process. The faith of the fifth line comes in here. You have to trust every single step because it is never complete. It is part of that illogical process that lies here at the
beginning of this. There is no guarantee of logic. There is nothing but this quality of faith which logical people, at their core, do not want to have to deal with. It is okay for a believer to say, "I believe that we
will have a cure for AIDS." That is very nice, but that is not the same as a logical person's attitude towards the very same phenomenon because the logical person says that it is possible that a cure for AIDS

that is exactly where the 9 goes in the circuitry.
